title: (x) "Remembering" similar to super thin Chevin - Gravur Condensed {Charles Grant}
content:
Any idea what this typeface is? Its reminiscent of a super thin Chevin

[http://i8.photobucket.com/albums/a48/lunardisko/Picture1.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20080705145108/http:/i8.photobucket.com/albums/a48/lunardisko/Picture1.png "http://i8.photobucket.com/albums/a48/lunardisko/Picture1.png")

 [‹ (x) "Special Events" sans, suspected free font - Fishsoup {Angel}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080705145108/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41505 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Poster behind Erik Spiekermann in "Helvetica" movie - Glaser Stencil {Jan E} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080705145108/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41503 "Go to next forum topic")
author: j. cullen

comments.content:
Ray Larabie’s [Wyvern](http://web.archive.org/web/20080705145108/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typodermic/wyvern/) is not identical, but it’s pretty close.

- Mike Yanega

So is [FF DIN Light](http://web.archive.org/web/20080705145108/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/ff-din/). The width is almost between condensed and regular,so a little Squooshing™ could be applied.

- Mike Yanega
